intro: Barkhausia candollei, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Proteaceae family, which includes many species with showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit and its clusters of golden-yellow, cup-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. The bark of the plant is thick and rugged, contributing to its resilience in harsh environmental conditions.
